I've used it and got little results. Could be used for a month but don't use it regularly (my dentist also recommended the same) as it would decay your enamle. If your teeths are very yellow then go for some Desi jugads (home made remidies) or consult your dentist. It won't fully brighten your teeth but would give some result. Overall, could be used for a month or less but do not even think of using it regularly :)

Brushing with this paste 3 times a day seems to make your teeth a bit sensitive, so I also ended up having to brush once a day with a sensitive relief paste, and seemed crazy to be brushing 4 times a day!The minty taste lingers in your mouth for a couple of minutes, although the freshness not for all that long. Should go for a mouth wash after too.While my teeth seem better, I do not believe they are 1 shade whiter, but I did miss the afternoon brush on a couple of occasions. Going to continue on this paste with 3x brushing for the month. Will update the review if anything changes.

This is just false advertisement. It wont do anything special but clean your teeth like a regular toothpaste. Whitening? hell no. In fact my teeth started to turn yellow. It's an ordinary toothpaste. Keeps your teeth clean if brush regularly just like any other toothpaste. Doesn't make your teeth 'one shade whiter' as the company claims.Bought the 200 gm. pack only because I got it in the lightning deal @ Rs. 79.

Don't believe that you will see changes in a week as advertised.I have been using this product for 3 months and I have seen some visible change in the color of my teeth.
